title: Jane Elissa Extravaganza — Prestigious competition marketing + application & payment flow

requirements.summary: Create a prestigious marketing site with clear prize messaging and navigation to Home, Apply, and FAQs.
acceptanceCriteria: Site has a clear home/landing page that states the competition purpose and the winner prize (performance at the Jane Elissa Extravaganza in Times Square NYC with Broadway stars).
Navigation provides access to at least: Home, Apply, FAQs.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the app shell and route wiring for Home, Apply, FAQs, and payment result pages; include a persistent top navigation and footer; ensure key messaging about the Times Square NYC/Broadway prize is present on the Home route.
Implement a premium header with logo/wordmark, refined navigation links (Home, Apply, FAQs), and responsive layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a formal footer with brief competition context and links to Apply/FAQs; keep copy English-only.

Build the Home/Landing page content: competition positioning, the winner prize statement (Times Square NYC event with Broadway stars), and CTA(s) to Apply; incorporate hero branding assets. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement a consistent, formal premium theme (charcoal/ivory with gold accents, refined typography, generous spacing) across all pages and components.
acceptanceCriteria: A single consistent theme is applied across pages (typography, colors, buttons, forms, and section styling).
The design avoids casual/“startup” styling and instead uses a formal, premium look.

file_operations.description: Adjust global CSS variables and base styles to a prestigious charcoal/ivory palette with gold accent tokens; set typographic defaults and form/button styling consistency via Tailwind/shadcn tokens.
Extend Tailwind theme (e.g., fontFamily, additional color aliases if needed) to support the premium design system and ensure consistent spacing/typography utilities across pages.
Create a shared layout wrapper for consistent page gutters, section spacing, and background styling; used by Home, Apply, and FAQs pages.

requirements.summary: Add an FAQs page accessible from navigation with readable, professional Q/A presentation.
acceptanceCriteria: FAQs are accessible from the main navigation.
FAQs are displayed in a readable, professional format (e.g., accordion or clearly separated Q/A blocks).

file_operations.description: Implement FAQs page with curated competition Q/A content rendered in a professional format (use shadcn/ui Accordion for expandable answers). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the FAQs page into routing and ensure the header navigation includes an FAQs link.

requirements.summary: Create an Apply page with validated application form supporting either video upload or YouTube link and required contact fields, with a clear submission success confirmation.
acceptanceCriteria: Application form includes applicant contact fields (at minimum: full name and email) and a video submission section with two options: upload a file OR paste a YouTube link.
Form validation enforces that exactly one video submission method is provided (upload OR YouTube link).
On successful submission, the user sees a clear success confirmation.
Backend persists submitted applications (including contact info, submission method, and timestamp) so they can be retrieved later.

file_operations.description: Build the Apply page and multi-step form UI (contact fields + video submission choice). Use shadcn/ui form primitives (Input, Label, Button, Card) and ensure validation enforces exactly one video method. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a React Query mutation hook that submits an application via the backend actor (submitApplication) and handles success/error states for the Apply flow.

Add helpers to build/validate a draft application object (including timestamp and generated id), store/retrieve it from sessionStorage during the payment redirect round-trip, and ensure only one of upload or YouTube link is present.
Wire the Apply page route and add navigation link to Apply in the header.

requirements.summary: Add a 75 CAD online payment step to the Apply flow and prevent finalization as paid/complete without completing the payment step.
acceptanceCriteria: The Apply flow clearly indicates the fee amount as 75 CAD before payment.
Users can complete an online payment step and then submit (or finalize) the application.
Backend stores a payment status for each application (e.g., pending/paid) along with any non-sensitive payment reference returned to the app.
Users cannot finalize an application as “paid/complete” without going through the payment step (per the app’s implemented payment flow).

file_operations.description: Implement Stripe checkout session creation using React Query and backend actor createCheckoutSession; JSON-parse the response and require a non-empty url before redirecting. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a lightweight gate that checks isStripeConfigured() and shows a clear non-technical message if payments are not configured (e.g., instruct applicant to try later/contact organizers) so the Apply flow fails gracefully. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a payment success route that reads Stripe session identifiers from the URL, calls getStripeSessionStatus, and then finalizes the stored application draft as paid/complete (including persisting a non-sensitive reference) before showing a confirmation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a payment failure route that communicates the failure, preserves the application draft state, and offers a route back to retry payment from Apply. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Integrate the payment step: show the 75 CAD fee prominently, create ShoppingItem data for the fee, redirect to Stripe via window.location.href, and only allow final submission once payment has returned as completed; persist draft state across redirect.
Register /payment-success and /payment-failure routes and ensure navigation/back links behave correctly after Stripe redirect.

requirements.summary: Add cause/impact messaging that application fees support leukemia and cancer research.
acceptanceCriteria: Cause/impact messaging appears on the site in at least one prominent location (e.g., Home page and/or Apply page).
Wording clearly states that application fees support leukemia and cancer research.

file_operations.description: Add a prominent cause/impact section stating that funds raised through application fees go towards leukemia and cancer research (English-only).
Add concise cause/impact messaging near the fee disclosure (75 CAD) to reinforce that application fees support leukemia and cancer research.

requirements.summary: Include generated static brand images (crest/logo, hero banner, subtle background pattern) and use them directly as frontend assets.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are added under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
At least a logo/crest and a hero/background visual are visibly used in the site UI.

file_operations.description: Add the generated crest/logo image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/competition-crest-logo.dim_512x512.png and ensure it is used in the header/branding.
Add the generated hero banner image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner.dim_1920x800.png and ensure it is used prominently on the Home page hero section.

Add the generated background tile asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/background-pattern-tile.dim_512x512.png and apply it subtly (e.g., as a site-wide background pattern) without reducing text readability.

Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/competition-crest-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header branding (static asset usage, not via backend). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner.dim_1920x800.png in the hero presentation and ensure it supports a prestigious look. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/background-pattern-tile.dim_512x512.png for a subtle repeating background pattern via global styling (ensure contrast and legibility).
